iso.read¶

class isopy.read.neptune(file)[source]¶

Used to read data files produced by a Neptune ICP-MS.

Parameters:
  • info (dict) – A dict of the information provided in the begining of the file (if given)
  • lines (dict) – A dict with the lines specified in the file.
isopy.read.standard_isotope_data(filepath=None)[source]¶

Standard isotope data for various properties

Datasets included in the default file: *L09 - *

If value cannot be converted to a float then it will be stored as a string.

file format: *First row describes the dataset *Second row is the name of the dataset. Will be the key in the returned dict. *First column is the nucleon number (A) of the isotope *Second column is the symbol of the isotope

Parameters:filepath (str) – Can be used to specify an alternative data file.
Returns:Keys corresponds to the datasets above. Values are another dict where the key is the isotope (e.g. 102Pd) and the associated value from the file.
Return type:dict

References

[1] Lodders 2009 et al. Abundances of the elements in the solar system
